page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The soil is{chalk}with{clay}on top and{flint}underneath.It is downland country which is undulating with few level fields.Fields are often sloping,with valleys diagonally across or sometimes a hill in the middle. The area is on the edge of true{chalk downland.The soil varies from{chalk with a thin layer of{loam,}to washed {gravel}of a stream bed of long ago; now a{winterbourne}which after a particularly wet year usually runs from February to May. The land west of the A34 is not so {chalky,}it is more{acid}with{clay}and the land is more level. The majority of the land is farmland and mainly arable.There are also well established woodlands and pastureland.
